title: Secure Browsing
longDescription: Secure browsing practices help protect your data and privacy when online.

items.title: Use a privacy-focused browser
items.description: Install a browser that prioritizes privacy
items.details: Consider browsers like Firefox, Brave, or Tor Browser that prioritize user privacy and offer enhanced security features.

items.title: Install security extensions
items.details: Install extensions like uBlock Origin to block ads and trackers, HTTPS Everywhere to enforce secure connections, and Privacy Badger to stop invisible trackers.

items.title: Enable HTTPS-only mode
items.details: Configure your browser to only connect to websites using HTTPS, which encrypts data transmitted between your browser and websites.

items.title: Clear browsing data regularly
items.details: Regularly clear cookies, browsing history, and cached files to minimize tracking and reduce stored sensitive data.

items.title: Use private browsing mode
items.details: Use private browsing/incognito mode when accessing sensitive websites to prevent local storage of browsing data.

items.title: Disable unnecessary permissions
items.details: Regularly review and restrict website permissions for location, camera, microphone, and notifications to only what's necessary.
